input_text:
Job Title: Unified Communications Engineer

Location: Milwaukee, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
TEKsystems is partnering with a large, local client in search of a Sr. Unified Communications Engineer this individual will be accountable for analysis, design, development, implementations, and upgrades of infrastructure, software, and technology solutions. Responsible for assisting with buy, rent, build decisions; designs and documents functional and non-functional requirements with appropriate methodology. Responsible for using best practices and knowledge of internal or external business needs to improve and meet service level expectations. Typically 8+ years of experience in the role.

Unified Communications Engineer with strong networking and telecommunications background. Should have hands-on experience in configuration, integration, and development of various telephony solutions including VOIP, SBC’s, SIP or similar. Accountabilities include the analysis, design, development, implementation, and maintenance of infrastructure, software, and telephony solutions. Responsibilities include designing, documenting, and implementing functional and non-functional requirements using NM approved methodology. Also responsible for using best practices and knowledge of internal or external business needs to achieve strategic objectives.

 Primary Duties And Responsibilities 

 Participate in the design, implementation, and long-term management of telephony related products and services. Collaborate with other cross functional teams to scope and launch new products, services, and features. Troubleshoot and debug VOIP integration and feature development issues. Optimize system performance and quality. Work with third party vendors to deliver and integrate solutions for the benefit of our customer base. Develop, maintain, and execute on disaster recovery / redundancy strategies. Ability to solve complex technical issues. Establish and maintain best practices as it relates to compliance, security, privacy, and legal requirements. Anticipate deviations from standard practices and find practical ways to move forward. Break down complex problems into smaller, more manageable ones, and help others to do the same. Understand what tools are available and useful for the domain, how they work, and the sorts of situations and problems for which they're useful.


 Qualifications 

 Bachelor's degree in Telecom, Electrical Engineering and or Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience. Minimum of 8 years of VOIP / Telecom relevant experience with development, integration, and deployment of complete solutions. Experience with real-time communication that include voice, telephony (SBC’s), SIP (Session Initiation Protocol), QoS, DHCP and DNS. Experience with multiple delivery methodologies such as Agile and Waterfall. Solid understanding of traditional or cloud computing technologies including Networking, Compute, Storage, Development, Data, Operations, or Security. Experience with Zoom Phone deployments a plus. Hands on Knowledge of Java/Python/Go concurrency / multithreading and asynchronous is a plus. Experience with CICD concepts, and tools, branching strategies and leveraging knowledge to assist in delivering an infrastructure as a product is a plus.


 About TEKsystems 

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
